update.description:
This pull request fixes the gains on the vehicle actuators so that tele-operation is largely restored, with some small workarounds required to tele-operate the hand-brake. This is based on the atlas_meshes branch, since the new pelvis allows much more stable seated behavior. It should also be tested with the 

Issues fixed:

* #176, vehicle responsiveness improved
* #124, min_brake_percent parameter added which causes deceleration when no gas is applied

Also, the VRCPlugin was modified to destroy the vehicle joint when changing /atlas/mode so the robot_enter_vehicle topic can be used to put the robot in the vehicle, then setting mode to nominal can test sitting in the car while unpinned.

UPDATE:

* retargeted to atlas_meshes_no_head_cage
* added u_leg collisions to mud_seat list
* merge with default
* Reduce max speed to 4.2 m/s and increase min_brake_percent to 4%
update.title: Fixes to vehicle plugin

content.raw: I fixed the seg-fault in pull request #503
content.html: I fixed the seg-fault in pull request #503

content.raw: This is a bug in the MudPlugin, that we're not checking the sensor pointer before accessing it at [MudPlugin.cc:118-121](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/9953d706da657bdba1b890490c94f1961534ad7c/plugins/MudPlugin.cc#cl-118), but I also think you are using an old version of the polaris model. Can you try the gazebo_models branch from the polaris pull request?
content.html: This is a bug in the MudPlugin, that we're not checking the sensor pointer before accessing it at MudPlugin.cc:118-121, but I also think you are using an old version of the polaris model. Can you try the gazebo_models branch from the polaris pull request?

update.description:
This pull request fixes the gains on the vehicle actuators so that tele-operation is largely restored, with some small workarounds required to tele-operate the hand-brake. This is based on the atlas_meshes branch, since the new pelvis allows much more stable seated behavior. It should also be tested with the 

Issues fixed:

* #176, vehicle responsiveness improved
* #124, min_brake_percent parameter added which causes deceleration when no gas is applied

Also, the VRCPlugin was modified to destroy the vehicle joint when changing /atlas/mode so the robot_enter_vehicle topic can be used to put the robot in the vehicle, then setting mode to nominal can test sitting in the car while unpinned.

UPDATE:

* retargeted to atlas_meshes_no_head_cage
* added u_leg collisions to mud_seat list
* merge with default
* Reduce max speed to 4.2 m/s and increase min_brake_percent to 4%
update.title: Fixes to vehicle plugin

content.html: I need to raise this to 16 km/hr (4.5 m/s).

This pull request fixes the gains on the vehicle actuators so that tele-operation is largely restored, with some small workarounds required to tele-operate the hand-brake. This is based on the atlas_meshes branch, since the new pelvis allows much more stable seated behavior. It should also be tested with the 

Issues fixed:

* #176, vehicle responsiveness improved
* #124, min_brake_percent parameter added which causes deceleration when no gas is applied

Also, the VRCPlugin was modified to destroy the vehicle joint when changing /atlas/mode so the robot_enter_vehicle topic can be used to put the robot in the vehicle, then setting mode to nominal can test sitting in the car while unpinned.

content.raw:
To test the pedal reach, enter the car with the following command:
~~~
rostopic pub -1 /drc_world/robot_enter_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: -0.01, z: -0.1}}'
~~~
Then follow the [atlas control with python tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/drcsim/2.5/Atlas_control_over_ROS_topics_with_python) and add the following lines to the Traj_data2.yaml file
~~~
gas_pedal_prep:
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.8 -0.1 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
gas_pedal_pulse:
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.8 -0.1 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.4  0.4 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
  - [3.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.6 1.4  0.4 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.8 -0.1 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
talladega:
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.8 -0.1 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.4  0.4 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
~~~
Run gas_pedal_prep and then gas_pedal_pulse or talladega to push the gas pedal. Note that the car won't move until you release the hand brake, either manually or with the following commands (an intermediate 0.5 command is needed due to a quirk in mixing the tele-operation code with bistable switch behavior of the mechanical interaction):
~~~
rostopic pub --once /drc_vehicle/hand_brake/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : 0.5 }'
rostopic pub --once /drc_vehicle/hand_brake/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : 0.0 }'
~~~
To test control of the pedals without the pin joint, set /atlas/mode to nominal, which breaks the pin joint and lets the robot fall onto the seat.
~~~
rostopic pub -1 /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- nominal
~~~
content.html:
To test the pedal reach, enter the car with the following command:

rostopic pub -1 /drc_world/robot_enter_car geometry_msgs/Pose '{position: {x: -0.01, z: -0.1}}'

Then follow the atlas control with python tutorial and add the following lines to the Traj_data2.yaml file

gas_pedal_prep:
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.8 -0.1 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
gas_pedal_pulse:
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.8 -0.1 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.4  0.4 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
  - [3.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.6 1.4  0.4 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.8 -0.1 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
talladega:
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.8 -0.1 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]
  - [1.0, "0 0 0 0      0.10 0 -1.6 1.6 -0.1 0       -0.25 0   -1.9 1.4  0.4 0    0 0 1.5 1.5 -3.0 0     0 0 1.5 -1.5 -3.0 0" ]

Run gas_pedal_prep and then gas_pedal_pulse or talladega to push the gas pedal. Note that the car won't move until you release the hand brake, either manually or with the following commands (an intermediate 0.5 command is needed due to a quirk in mixing the tele-operation code with bistable switch behavior of the mechanical interaction):

rostopic pub --once /drc_vehicle/hand_brake/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : 0.5 }'
rostopic pub --once /drc_vehicle/hand_brake/cmd std_msgs/Float64 '{ data : 0.0 }'

To test control of the pedals without the pin joint, set /atlas/mode to nominal, which breaks the pin joint and lets the robot fall onto the seat.

rostopic pub -1 /atlas/mode std_msgs/String -- nominal

update.description:
This pull request fixes the gains on the vehicle actuators so that tele-operation is largely restored, with some small workarounds required to tele-operate the hand-brake. This is based on the atlas_meshes branch, since the new pelvis allows much more stable seated behavior. It should also be tested with the 

Issues fixed:

* #176, vehicle responsiveness improved
* #124, min_brake_percent parameter added which causes deceleration when no gas is applied

Also, the VRCPlugin was modified to destroy the vehicle joint when changing /atlas/mode so the robot_enter_vehicle topic can be used to put the robot in the vehicle, then setting mode to nominal can test sitting in the car while unpinned.

UPDATE:

* retargeted to atlas_meshes_no_head_cage
update.title: Fixes to vehicle plugin
